main event: A civilian reported observing a round object in Battle Creek, Michigan on April 18, 1966.
interesting points: The object was approximately 80 feet long, 40 feet wide, and 15 feet thick,The object was observed for about 7 minutes and was about 100 feet above and 75 feet ahead of the observer,It had a sandstone color with a cabin and large fins that turned white hot before disappearing,The object followed the observer's car and created a green reflection on its hood,The report concluded with insufficient data and requested a follow-up form for more evaluation.
sighted object: a round object with a cabin and large fins
witness description: A 42-year-old male with service in the Air Force, employed at Post Cereal Company
